snippet: Experts were stunned by a study of 12,000 patients that showed the drug, evacetrapib, had no effect in preventing heart attacks, strokes or death from heart disease.
abstract: American College of Cardiology announces study published online in JAMA unexpectedly finding that promising drug evacetrapib is ineffective in fighting heart disease; potential alternative to statins, which reduced LDL cholesterol and boosted HDL cholesterol, did not produce cardiac benefits researchers expected.
lead_paragraph: Experts were stunned by a study of 12,000 patients that showed the drug, evacetrapib, had no effect in preventing heart attacks, strokes or death from heart disease.

headline.main: Dashing Hopes, Study Shows a Cholesterol Drug Had No Effect on Heart Health
headline.print_headline: Dashing Hopes, Study Shows a Cholesterol Drug Had No Effect on Heart Health

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN MEDICAL ASSN
